# Question

Write a function `wrap_string`. It iterates over words and it will add a new line each time a maximum `text_width::Int=10` would be exceeded. Provide an example

You can create a function `wrap_string` in Julia that breaks a string into lines based on a specified maximum width. Here's an example of how to implement it:

```julia
function wrap_string(input_string::String, text_width::Int=10)
    words = split(input_string)
    wrapped_lines = String[]
    current_line = ""

    for word in words
        if length(current_line) + length(word) + 1 > text_width
            push!(wrapped_lines, current_line)
            current_line = word
        else
            if current_line == ""
                current_line = word
            else
                current_line *= " " * word
            end
        end
    end

    if current_line != ""
        push!(wrapped_lines, current_line)
    end

    return join(wrapped_lines, "\n")
end

# Example usage
wrapped_text = wrap_string("This is an example of how we can wrap text based on a maximum width.", 10)
println(wrapped_text)
```
